skillTree.localised_description: An extremely light yet resilient material, Ithilmar gives the same protection as heavy steel, but without slowing down its wearer.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can fire while on the move.
Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.
This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

skillTree.localised_description: With its magnificent frame and the great plumes of steam of its snorting breath, the Great Stag instils unflinching valour into those who ride it.

This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can fire while on the move.
Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.
This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

skillTree.localised_description: Fly on your wings, like an eagle. Touch the sun. Track the foe, ambush, and defeat.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.

This unit can fly.

skillTree.localised_description: The God of the Hunt freely gifts his deific zeal for war to all nobles deemed worthy of their responsibilities to Athel Loren.

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +25% during forest battles
	(Hero's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Longbow kinbands are regimented and resourceful when defending their forest homes, advancing and retreating like leaves in a storm.
The Trickster God knows all manner of ploys and ruses that can be used to counter missile attacks.
Knowledge can be used as a shield against magical attack.
Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say noâ€¦

effects.description: When normally killed in action, this Hero will be wounded instead

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +10% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +20% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type

skillTree.localised_description: When the arrow flies farther, it may kill sooner, which is vital in the Hunt.

ui_effects.localised_text: Requires line of sight to the target

skillTree.localised_description: Nook and fire. Nook again, and fire. Nook a third time, and fire. All in a heartbeat.
The forest teaches a warrior not only when to fire but where, which makes a bigger difference.
Always willing to fight on, a widened quiver allows arrows to rain, almost without end.
What the enemy cannot see, it cannot hit. What the enemy cannot see, it cannot survive.
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Taking their cue from the forest itself, the Lord endures and overcomes all.
Using the forest itself as a shield, this Lord is protected by their devotion to Athel Loren.
When to strike, when to block, when to dodge. These are all skills the warriors of Athel Loren must perfect.
There is no greater thrill than to be in the midst of battle, slaughtering in the forest's name.
The bigger they are, the harder they fall.

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: Perfectly at home in the saddle, this warrior can ride at full-pelt through terrain others would struggle with on foot.

effects.description:
Vigour loss reduction: -10% for cavalry units
	(Hero's army)
Attribute: Strider when mounted on an Elven Steed or Great Stag

skillTree.localised_description: Following the example of the Doomstar, this warrior specializes in devastating, demoralizing strikes from the sky.

effects.description: Attribute: Causes Terror when mounted on a Great Eagle

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

	(Hero's army)

skillTree.localised_description: A member of the Wardancer kindred, this warrior fights to Loec's silent song.

skillTree.localised_description: This ritualistic war dance requires neither rhythm nor order, enabling evasion of the enemyâ€™s clumsy attacks, and lethal counterattacks.
Once consumed by Loecâ€™s aspect, one can instinctively evade attack through trickery, mimicking his deception of the Dark Gods.

effects.description: Passive ability: "Possessed by the Trickster God"

skillTree.localised_description: A legendary presence, on the battlefield and off.
My lord, I believe Iâ€™ve found something of interest...

skillTree.localised_description: We all must fight, no matter our station.
Iâ€™ve managed to procure some additional supplies for the troops, my lord.

	(own armies in region)

skillTree.localised_description: We will not allow them to take our homes, our lands!
We will establish triage and treatment centers as soon as we make camp, my lord.

	(own armies in region)

skillTree.localised_description: Whether it be training harder, travelling lighter, eating less or sleeping better, there's always a way to draw more from the day.

skillTree.localised_description: Such magic-users may be wise and able to offer sage advice, especially if they have scried the region.

Boost Income action: Income is modified by an additional 6%

skillTree.localised_description: It is not just the forces of Chaos that can despoil, break and ruin.

skillTree.localised_description: Such a champion will not bend or break, but slay in their Lord's name.

skillTree.localised_description: Lying in wait, experienced and patient, striking when the foe least expects.

skillTree.localised_description: An expert in their craft, this Hero knows all the mistakes that can be made and how to best avoid making them.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Those whom the Mage Queen has favoured fight as if powered by her hand.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The first arrow of battle must fly truest.
Being fleet of foot is useful in a fightâ€¦ or when trying to get away afterwards!

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Having a modicum of resolve is useful in a world that continually tests it.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Self-belief is a fine thing when not misplaced.

effects.description:
Experience gain: +5% for units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.
If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.
Well built, robust. Powerful.
If you can swing, slash, stab, gouge, or shoot it, this warrior has mastered every aspect of its use.
This being has a plan - not just a game plan, but a master plan to achieve their long-term aims.
Careful planning, knowledge of the terrain and the weaknesses of the enemy are the key to victory.

effects.description:
Enemy battle reinforcement time: +10%
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Atop a great pyramid in the highest heaven, Asuryan watches over the world alone and has never been seen by mortals.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -4% for Great Eagle and Hawk Rider units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Whatever the motivation, legend tells that when Asuryan learned of Hoeth's actions, he rebuked the Lord of Wisdom, and in punishment, set much of Hoeth's great library ablaze.
As the goddess of nature, Isha taught the Elves how to care for the land and gain a plentiful harvest.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +5%
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: By tradition, she is the only goddess to any longer walk the mortal world, and there are tales of her coming to the aid of those lost amidst the mists of Yvresse or upon the trackless ocean.
It is claimed that she reads the intention written in the heart of every elf and judges them not by their deeds, but by their hearts desire.
The Elf legends tell that Loec often saves the souls of the dead from Slaanesh by tricking the Dark Prince out of his prize.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve: +1 per turn

Enemy Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: -10
	(enemy armies in region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Enslaved to Khaine's will, Vaul is forced to make weapons of extraordinary power for the War God's eternal battle against the great enemy.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +4 for Wardancer and Bladesinger units
	(all units in army)
